title: New bipartisan Senate TikTok bill will be unveiled Tuesday
description: Democratic Sen. Mark Warner and Republican John Thune will unveil a highly anticipated bill to give the president broad power to address threats from TikTok.

title: Google tells employees that fewer of them will get promotions to senior roles
description: Google said in an email to employees that it hopes to increase senior and leadership roles "in proportion" to company growth

title: Taiwan is paying tourists to visit—here's what you need to know
description: Taiwan's government announced it will offer tourists $165 to vacation in the region.

title: Google CEO defends desk-sharing policy, says some offices are like a 'ghost town'
description: In responding to employee criticism of Google's new desk-sharing policy for the cloud unit, CEO Sundar Pichai reminded staffers that real estate is pricey.

title: Fed's Powell heads to Capitol Hill this week, and he's going to have his hands full
description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell appears before Congress with a tall task.

title: Companies that give up stock buybacks for 5 years will get preferential treatment in $52 billion CHIPS program, Commerce Secretary Raimondo says
description: Raimondo said stock buybacks is one factor being taken into consideration as part of a $39-billion manufacturing subsidy program.

title: Prosecutors in Alec Baldwin 'Rust' shooting case are getting heat over apparent missteps
description: Alec Baldwin's lawyers say the special prosecutor, Andrea Reeb, isn't permitted by New Mexico's Constitution to try the case.

title: Marlboro maker Altria agrees to buy e-cigarette startup NJOY for nearly $2.8 billion
description: Altria's deal to buy NJOY comes after the Marlboro maker exited its position in Juul Labs.

title: Toblerone chocolate to cut iconic Matterhorn logo from packaging due to 'Swissness' laws
description: Switzerland requires milk-based products promoting themselves as Swiss to be made entirely within the country.

title: Saudi Arabia drops $5 billion in Turkey's central bank to help its struggling economy
description: The news comes as Turkey struggles with an economy battered by years of high inflation and a recent series of devastating earthquakes.

title: Iran says it's discovered what could be the world's second-largest lithium deposit
description: The ministry believes that the deposit holds 8.5 million ton of lithium, which is often called "white gold" for the rapidly-growing electric vehicle industry.

title: No current plan for the UAE to leave OPEC oil alliance, sources say
description: The UAE does not currently plan to leave the influential OPEC producers' alliance, according to two officials with knowledge of the matter.

title: Tesla cuts Model S and Model X prices in the U.S. to stoke demand
description: Tesla has cut prices on its two most expensive models in the U.S., the Model S and Model X, in a renewed bid to stoke demand for its cars.

title: Embattled Adani Group receives a vote of confidence from U.S. asset manager
description: Rajiv Jain is the co-founder and CIO of GQG Partners and is best known for investing in stable growing companies in the tobacco and energy sectors.

title: China takes a cautious approach to its economy in 2023
description: China's leaders struck a cautious tone about the outlook for the country's economic rebound, after ending most Covid restrictions on business activity.

title: Meet the woman who invented a whole new subsection of tech set to be worth $1 trillion
description: Ida Tin coined the term "FemTech" in 2016, which describes all tech that aims to tackle health issues that only, or disproportionately, impact women.

title: Apple may launch mixed reality device this year — but we're not scared, HTC CEO says
description: Apple will likely launch a mixed reality product "very soon" — potentially as soon as this year, HTC CEO and co-founder Cher Wang told CNBC.

title: CNBC Daily Open: The Nasdaq soared last week. But tech might be in trouble
description: All major indexes ended last week in the green, with the Nasdaq outpacing the Dow and S&P. But not all is rosy in the tech industry.

title: As Apple rumors swirl, Chinese rivals launch foldable smartphones to challenge Samsung
description: Chinese vendors Oppo and Honor have launched foldable smartphones for the international market in a bid to challenge Samsung in the device category it pioneered.

title: This teenager is breaking records at soccer and training with the boys — and she's hungry for more
description: Danelle Tan, 18, made history as the first Singaporean woman to play in a European league, after making her debut for the London Bees.

title: Gender pay gap could cost the world economy $7 trillion, Moody's says
description: On average, women make a higher upfront investment in education but tend to land in lower-level and lower-paid positions, employed below their skill level, Moody's said in a report.
